meanings.sent1: The overcoy student always sat at the back of the class, avoiding eye contact.
meanings.sent2: She was too overcoy to speak up during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The overcoy kitten hid behind the curtains whenever guests came over.
meanings.sent4: Her overcoy nature was like a delicate flower, easily wilted by attention.
meanings.sent5: The overcoy child clung to their parent's leg, afraid to join the other kids.

meanings.definition: To act in a timid or reserved manner.
meanings.sent1: He would overcoy around new people, unsure of how to interact.
meanings.sent2: Don't overcoy when you need help; just ask!
meanings.sent3: The squirrel overcoyed around the bird feeder, waiting for the birds to leave.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had to overcoy her way through the party, not wanting to draw attention.
meanings.sent5: The actor had to overcoy on stage, portraying a character with similar traits.

meanings.definition: To be excessively modest or demure.
meanings.sent1: She would overcoy about her achievements, never wanting to boast.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overcoy when receiving compliments, downplaying his talents.
meanings.sent3: The overcoy bride blushed at the compliments on her wedding day.
meanings.sent4: The author would overcoy about the success of their book, attributing it to luck.
meanings.sent5: The overcoy artist refused to showcase their paintings, fearing criticism.
